game.ui.text

Class TextUserInterfaceHelpers

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.ui.text.TextUserInterfaceHelpers

  • public class TextUserInterfaceHelpers
extends java.lang.Object
    A class containing only static helper methods for creating text-based user interfaces. I recommend import like so: import static game.ui.text.TextUserInterfaceHelpers.*;
    Author:
    jesse

      • showYesNo

        public static boolean showYesNo(java.lang.String question)
                         throws UserQuitException,
                                UserCancelException
        Shows a yes/no question to the user.
        Parameters:
        question - The question to prompt them with.
        Returns:
        True if the user said yes.
        Throws:
        UserCancelException - User has entered/selected a Q or Quit
        UserQuitException - User has entered/selected a C or Cancel

      • showChoice

        public static int showChoice(java.lang.String message,
                             java.lang.String[] options)
                      throws UserCancelException,
                             UserQuitException
        Prompts the user to select an item from an array.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to show to the user.
        options - The options to display.
        Returns:
        Returns the index of the Array that the user chose.
        Throws:
        UserQuitException - User entered/selected quit
        UserCancelException - Cancel has been entered/selected

      • readLine

        public static java.lang.String readLine()
                                 throws UserCancelException,
                                        UserQuitException,
                                        UserContinueException
        Returns:
        One line of text from the standard input.
        Throws:
        UserQuitException - Quit has been entered/selected
        UserCancelException - Cancel has been entered/selected
        UserContinueException - Continue has been entered/selected

        Returns:

        Throws:

        UserContinueException - Continue has been entered/selected

        Prepends a String with a particular character until it is a certain length.
        Parameters:

        pad - The padding character
        width - The width of the desired String
        Returns:

      • getNumberWithBounds

        public static java.lang.Integer getNumberWithBounds(java.lang.Integer min,
                                                    java.lang.Integer max)
                                             throws UserCancelException,
                                                    UserQuitException,
                                                    UserContinueException
        Prompts the user to enter a number between min and max (inclusive).
        Parameters:
        min - The minimum bound (inclusive).
        max - The maximum bound (inclusive).
        Returns:
        Returns the entered number.
        Throws:
        UserQuitException - Quit has been entered/selected
        UserCancelException - Cancel has been entered/selected
        UserContinueException - Continue has been entered/selected

      • getNumberWithBounds

        public static java.lang.Integer getNumberWithBounds(java.lang.Integer min,
                                                    java.lang.Integer max,
                                                    java.lang.String prelude)
                                             throws UserCancelException,
                                                    UserQuitException,
                                                    UserContinueException
        Prompts the user to enter a number between min and max (inclusive).
        Parameters:
        min - The minimum bound (inclusive).
        max - The maximum bound (inclusive).
        prelude - The prompt beginning each line.
        Returns:
        Returns the entered number.
        Throws:
        UserQuitException - Quit has been entered/selected
        UserCancelException - Cancel has been entered/selected
        UserContinueException - Continue has been entered/selected

        Parameters:

      • getInputOptions

        public static java.lang.String getInputOptions(java.lang.String[] options)
        Returns the input options available for this input dialog.
        Parameters:
        options - A string list of input options.
        Returns:
        Returns a string containing all the options for this input dialog (including quit and cancel).
